paper.title: Benefits of quantile regression for the analysis of customer lifetime value in a contractual setting: An application in financial services
paper.abstract: The move towards a customer-centred approach to marketing, coupled with the increasing availability of customer transaction data, has led to an interest in understanding and estimating customer lifetime value (CLV). Several authors point out that, when evaluating customer profitability, profitable customers are rare compared to the unprofitable ones. In spite of this, most authors fail to recognize the implications of these skewed distributions on the performance of models they use. In this study, we propose analyzing CLV by means of quantile regression. In a financial services application, we show that this technique provides management more in-depth insights into the effects of the covariates that are missed with linear regression. Moreover, we show that in the common situation where interest is in a top-customer segment, quantile regression outperforms linear regression. The method also has the ability of constructing prediction intervals. Combining the CLV point estimate with the prediction intervals leads to a new segmentation scheme that is the first to account for uncertainty in the predictions. This segmentation is ideally suited for managing the portfolio of customers. (C) 2009 Published by Elsevier Ltd.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究客户终身价值（CLV）的分析方法，并应用分位数回归技术来改进客户细分和管理。虽然提到了金融服务的应用，但核心内容属于客户关系管理和营销分析，并未直接涉及衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等金融研究领域。
